row shaping k1 16 16 20 20 20 20 20 20 sts row 1 rs k1 ssk work in patt to 5 sts rem w&t 15 next row ws p2 work in patt to 2 sts rem p2 15 19 19 19 19 19 19 sts next row k1 sssk work in patt to 3 sts rem k2tog k1 row 2 ws work in patt to 2 sts rem p2 13 13 17 17 17 17 17 17 sts sleeve cap meas 6 25 6 5 row 3 k1 sssk work in patt to 2 sts rem before prev 7 8 25 8 5 9 5 9 5 9 75 16 16 5 18 21 21 5 24 24 wrapped st w+t 13 13 17 17 17 17 17 17 sts 25 cm same as front raglan row 4 work in patt to 2 sts rem p2 row 5 k1 sssk work in patt to 4 sts rem picking up each begin short row shaping wrap and working it with the st it wrapped k3tog k1 9 9 row 1 ws p2 work in patt to 5 sts rem w+ t 13 13 13 13 13 13 sts row 2 rs work in patt to 4 sts rem k3tog k1 11 11 15 15 15 15 15 15 sts bobble all sts row 3 p2 work in patt to 2 sts rem before prev wrapped st w+t finishing row 4 work in patt to 4 sts rem k3tog k1 9 9 13 13 soak pieces in cool water in wool wash and block to 13 13 13 13 sts measurements seam side sleeve and raglan seams using row 5 p2 work in patt to 2 sts rem picking up each wrap mattress stitch taking care to match the longer raglan edges and working it with the stitch it wrapped p2 of the back sleeve caps with the back body bobble all sts neck tabs make sure each neck tab reaches across the top of the left sleeve sleeve to center back neck adding or removing row if work as for right sleeve to armhole shaping 44 46 52 necessary to adjust length place 8 sts of each front neck 54 54 58 58 60 sts tab on separate spare ndls hold pieces together with rs of tabs touching each other using the main ndl as the working begin sleeve cap shaping ndl and yarn tail attached to one neck tab join sts using the notes maintain moss stitch pattern as set throughout remainder three-needle bind-off method sew edge of joined neck of sleeve the left sleeve cap is taller its back edge beginning tabs to tops of sleeves and back neck of rs row end of ws row to match the taller back
